books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Sean Hannity
books.description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election.
books.name: LIVE FREE OR DIE

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Bryan Stevenson
books.description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.
books.name: JUST MERCY

books.author: by Mary L. Trump
books.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.
books.name: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
books.name: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: by Lauren Akins with Mark Dagostino
books.description: The wife of the country music singer Thomas Rhett describes her mission work and life in the spotlight.
books.name: LIVE IN LOVE

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Alex Trebek
books.description: Who is the Canadian-American game show host whose pronunciation of the word “genre” has been shared widely on social media?
books.name: THE ANSWER IS ...

books.author: by Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
books.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s journey from courtship to their decision to step away from their royal lives.
books.name: FINDING FREEDOM

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: An account of the Great Migration of 1915-70, in which nearly six million African-Americans abandoned the South.
books.name: THE WARMTH OF OTHER SUNS

books.author: by Stuart Stevens
books.description: The former political campaign strategist evaluates the changes within the Republican Party in the last half-century.
books.name: IT WAS ALL A LIE

books.author: by Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.
books.name: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE
